title: Dragon Caused the Storm at Loguetown
theory: Many fans theorize that Monkey D. Dragon has a Devil Fruit power (possibly a mythical zoan) that allows him to control weather. The massive storm that appears in Loguetown during later episodes was caused by Dragon to protect his son Luffy, not just a coincidence.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidenceFor: Dragon's arrival is always preceded by dramatic weather changes
The timing of the storm perfectly saves Luffy from capture
Dragon's presence in Loguetown at the exact moment suggests intention
Chapter 1101 later confirms Dragon keeps tabs on Luffy in East Blue
evidenceAgainst: Weather manipulation has never been explicitly confirmed
Could be narrative coincidence rather than Devil Fruit power
Some argue it was Luffy's own luck/Will of D

title: Tashigi is Actually Kuina or Related to Her
theory: Due to Tashigi's striking resemblance to Kuina (both in appearance and personality), some fans theorize they are either the same person (Kuina survived and lost her memory) or are secretly related as sisters or twins. However, Oda has stated their resemblance is just coincidence.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidenceFor: Identical appearance between Tashigi and Kuina
Both share passion for swords and similar personalities
Same voice actress in all anime adaptations
Both have the same blood type
Names both reference flightless birds (symbolism)
Some theorize Kuma removed Kuina's memories
evidenceAgainst: Eiichiro Oda officially stated at Jump Festa 2008: 'It's just a coincidence. There's no backstory like Tashigi turns out to be Kuina's sister or something'
Age and timeline don't match for them to be the same person
Kuina's death was shown and mourned
Thematic purpose is to challenge Zoro emotionally, not reveal a twist

title: Why Dragon Was in Loguetown
theory: Fans debated for years why Monkey D. Dragon appeared in Loguetown at the exact moment Luffy was there. Theories ranged from pure coincidence to Dragon tracking his son. Chapter 1101 later confirmed that Dragon deliberately keeps tabs on Luffy whenever he returns to East Blue, suggesting he wanted to ensure Luffy's safety before entering the Grand Line.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidenceFor: Chapter 1101 explicitly confirms Dragon monitors Luffy in East Blue
Dragon's presence saved Luffy from Smoker/Buggy
Timing was too convenient to be pure coincidence
Dragon showed interest in Luffy's pirate path versus revolutionary path
evidenceAgainst: Initially appeared to be coincidental in early chapters

title: The Lightning That Saved Luffy Was His Own Haki
theory: Some fans theorize that the lightning that struck during the Loguetown Arc wasn't caused by Dragon but was actually an unconscious manifestation of Luffy's Conqueror's Haki or even foreshadowing of his Nika powers. This theory suggests Luffy's incredible luck is actually his latent power manifesting.
author: One Piece Theory Community
evidenceFor: Luffy has displayed incredible luck throughout the series
The Will of D is associated with bringing storms
Could be early foreshadowing of Luffy's true powers
Conqueror's Haki can manifest unconsciously in dire situations
evidenceAgainst: Dragon's presence strongly suggests he caused the weather
No other evidence of Luffy affecting weather with Haki
Occam's Razor suggests Dragon's powers are the simpler explanation
Lightning came from outside forces, not from Luffy

title: Smoker Witnessed Roger's Execution for a Reason
theory: Smoker's presence at Roger's execution as a child wasn't just backstory - some fans believe it will have greater significance. Perhaps Smoker heard something Roger said that wasn't public, or his determination to stop pirates stems from a personal interaction or observation that day that hasn't been fully revealed.
author: One Piece Analysts
evidenceFor: Smoker's flashback is given significant narrative weight
His motivation seems deeper than just upholding justice
Many significant characters have connections to Roger
The focus on young Smoker's reaction suggests importance
evidenceAgainst: May just be character backstory without deeper meaning
Many people witnessed the execution with no special significance
Smoker's motivation seems straightforward - justice and order
